member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DisableAttribute
member.summary:
Attribute that can be applied to job functions, trigger parameters and classes to conditionally disable triggered functions.
For example, by using this attribute, you can dynamically disable functions temporarily by changing application settings. Note that the disable check is done on startup only. If a in the hierarchy (Parameter/Method/Class) exists and indicates that the function should be disabled, the listener for that function will not be started. The attribute only affects triggered functions.
Additionally, when running in an Azure Web App, you can set app setting WEBJOBS_STOPPED to 1 to completely disable the JobHost. In this case the JobHost won't even be started.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DisableAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DisableAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: The name of an application setting or environment variable that governs whether the function(s) should be disabled. If the specified setting exists and its value is "1" or "True", the function will be disabled. The setting name can contain binding parameters (e.g. {MethodName}, {MethodShortName}, %test%, etc.).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DisableAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: A Type which implements a method named "IsDisabled" taking a and returning . This function will be called to determine whether the target function should be disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DisableAttribute.SettingName
member.summary: Gets the name of the application setting or environment variable that will be used to determine whether the function(s) should be disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DisableAttribute.ProviderType
member.summary: Gets the custom that will be invoked to determine whether the function(s) should be disabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.NoAutomaticTriggerAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to mark a job function that will not be automatically triggered.
member.remarks:
This attribute is useful in two cases:
Functions with triggers Prevents automatic invocation of the triggers, allowing manual polling.
Functions without other attributes Flags the function as an available job function.
In both cases, functions marked with this attribute are never called automatically by JobHost when running. Instead, they must be invoked manually using the Call method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute can be applied to a job functions to ensure that only a single instance of the function is executed at any given time (even across host instances). A blob lease is used behind the scenes to implement the lock.
This attribute can also be used in mode to ensure that the listener for a triggered function is only running on a single instance. Trigger bindings can make this implicit by applying the attribute to their IListener implementation. Functions can override an implicit singleton by applying a singleton to their function with mode .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonScope)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance using the specified scope settings.
member.param: The scope value for the singleton lock. This value can be used to implement finer grained locks by including binding parameters that bind to function input data.

The to use. When set to , the lock is only scoped to the specific function, meaning invocations of that function will be serialized. To implement locking across multiple functions, you can use and apply the same attribute to multiple functions. Each function will then use the same lock, and invocations of all the functions will be serialized. The default value is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute.ScopeId
member.summary: Gets the scope identifier for the singleton lock.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the this singleton should use. Defaults to if not explicitly specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the this singleton should use. Defaults to if not explicitly specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute.Account
member.summary: Gets the name of the Azure Storage account that the blob lease should be created in.
member.remarks: If not specified, the default AzureWebJobs storage account will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonAttribute.LockAcquisitionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout value in seconds for lock acquisition. If the lock is not obtained within this interval, the invocation will fail. When set, this value will override the corresponding global configuration value set in JobHostConfiguration.Singleton.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonMode
member.summary: Enumeration of modes that can operate in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonMode.Function
member.summary: Indicates a singleton lock that is taken before each function invocation, and released immediately after. This is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonMode.Listener
member.summary: Indicates a singleton lock that is taken when starting the listener for a triggered function. Using this mode, the listener (and therefore the function) will only be running on a single instance (when scaled out).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonScope
member.summary: Enumeration of values used to control the scope of Singleton locks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonScope.Function
member.summary: Indicates a Singleton lock that is scoped a single function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.SingletonScope.Host
member.summary:
Indicates a Singleton lock that is scoped to the JobHost.
This is useful in scenarios where locking across multiple functions is desired. In this case the same attribute can be applied to multiple functions, and they'll share the same lock.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.StorageAccountAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to override the default Azure Storage account used by triggers and binders.
member.remarks: This attribute can be applied at the parameter/method/class level, and the precedence is in that order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.StorageAccountAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: A string value indicating the Azure Storage connection string to use. This string should be in one of the following formats. These checks will be applied in order and the first match wins. - The name of an "AzureWebJobs" prefixed app setting or connection string name. E.g., if your setting name is "AzureWebJobsMyStorage", you can specify "MyStorage" here. - Can be a string containing %% values (e.g. %StagingStorage%). The value provided will be passed to any INameResolver registered on the JobHostConfiguration to resolve the actual setting name to use. - Can be an app setting or connection string name of your choosing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.StorageAccountAttribute.Account
member.summary: Gets or sets the app setting name that contains the Azure Storage connection string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.StorageAccountAttribute.Microsoft#Azure#WebJobs#IConnectionProvider#Connection
member.summary: Gets or sets the app setting name that contains the Azure Storage connection string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimeoutAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that can be applied at the class or function level to limit the execution time of job functions. To receive the timeout cancellation, a function must include a parameter. Then, if a particular function invocation exceeds the timeout, the will be cancelled, and an error will be logged. The function should monitor the token for cancellation and abort when it is cancelled, and it should pass it to any async operations it initiates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimeoutAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: The timeout limit as a string (e.g. "00:30:00").

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimeoutAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: The timeout limit as a string (e.g. "00:30:00").
The gracePeriod as a string (e.g. "00:30:00").

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimeoutAttribute.Timeout
member.summary: Gets the timeout value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimeoutAttribute.TimeoutWhileDebugging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether function invocations will timeout when a is specified and a debugger is attached. False by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimeoutAttribute.ThrowOnTimeout
member.summary: When true, an exception is thrown when a function timeout expires.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimeoutAttribute.GracePeriod
member.summary: The amount of time to wait between canceling the timeout and throwing a FunctionTimeoutException. This gives functions time to perform any graceful shutdown. Only applies if is true.
